entries.name: Schrodinger (without i via Madelung + Phase-Lift)
entries.description: Madelung + Phase-Lift split into continuity and Hamilton-Jacobi style real equations.
entries.definitions: Q[rho] is the quantum potential term; phi is the lifted phase field.
assumptions: rho is positive and smooth enough for Q[rho] to be well-defined.
Phase-Lift variable theta_R maps consistently to phi over the domain.
entries.caveat: Equivalent only under the stated smoothness and phase mapping assumptions.

entries.name: Aharonov-Bohm phase (Phase-Lifted)
entries.equationLatex: \theta_R[\gamma]=\mathrm{unwrap}\!\big(\frac{q}{\hbar}\oint_\gamma \mathbf A\cdot d\mathbf\ell;\theta_{\rm ref},\pi_a\big)=\frac{q}{\hbar}\int_S \mathbf B\cdot d\mathbf S + 2\pi_a w
entries.description: Phase-Lifted AB phase relation with explicit winding sector.
entries.definitions: theta_R is unwrapped phase; w is integer winding sector.
assumptions: Gauge region excludes singular crossings during unwrapping.
Chosen reference phase remains consistent along gamma.
entries.caveat: Branch handling is convention-dependent without a fixed unwrapping policy.

entries.name: Berry phase / overlap product (no multivalued Arg)
entries.description: Discrete Berry-phase accumulation with unwrapped phase tracking.
entries.definitions: Arg denotes principal argument before unwrapping.
assumptions: Adjacent state overlaps are non-zero along the path.
Sampling is fine enough to avoid unwrap jumps.
entries.caveat: Numerical stability depends on path discretization and overlap conditioning.

entries.name: Josephson relations (Phase-Lift + adaptive-pi)
entries.description: Adaptive-pi phase dynamics inserted into Josephson current/voltage relations.
entries.definitions: pi_a is an adaptive period parameter replacing fixed pi in phase scaling.
assumptions: pi_a varies slowly relative to junction dynamics.
Calibration restores the classical limit when pi_a approaches pi.
entries.caveat: Non-standard phase scaling requires experimental calibration before physical claims.

entries.name: Path integral with Phase-Lift sectors
entries.equationLatex: Z=\sum_{w\in\mathbb Z}\int \mathcal D\rho\,\mathcal D\theta_R\,\mathcal D\pi_a\; e^{\frac{i}{\hbar}S_{PL}[\rho,\theta_R,\pi_a]}\;\delta(\theta_R(T)-\theta_R(0)-2\pi_a w)
entries.description: Sector-aware path integral with explicit winding constraint.
entries.definitions: S_PL is the proposed Phase-Lift action functional.
assumptions: Measure and action are well-defined under the Phase-Lift parameterization.
Sector sum converges or is regularized consistently.
entries.caveat: S_PL must be specified explicitly for reproducible calculations.

entries.name: U(N) holonomy split (Phase-Lift det-phase)
entries.description: Separates determinant phase and tracks lifted winding in U(N) holonomy.
entries.definitions: V is the SU(N) component after factoring determinant phase.
assumptions: Holonomy path admits stable determinant phase unwrapping.
Global phase convention is fixed over the loop.
entries.caveat: Winding assignment can shift under different gauge conventions.

entries.name: Klein-Gordon (polar split + Phase-Lift)
entries.description: Polar/Phase-Lift form of Klein-Gordon with explicit adaptive-pi phase mapping.
entries.definitions: Box is the d'Alembertian operator; psi is relativistic scalar field.
assumptions: Polar decomposition remains valid where psi is non-zero.
Relativistic and non-relativistic terms are not mixed in derived reductions.
entries.caveat: Use caution: some downstream interpretations can mix relativistic and non-relativistic forms.
